metadata.title: RA8: Using Helium with the CM85 core

sections.content:
Question:
How can I use Helium to accelerate my DSP or AI/ML task?
Answer:
The Cortex-M85 core based on the Arm v8.1-M architecture brings Helium (Arm MVE) to the RA8 series, for acceleration of DSP and AI/ML tasks. CMSIS-NN and DSP libraries, with full support for Helium are available now and should be linked into the project in order to enable Helium Intrinsics. Additionally, users need to use Helium enabled compilers such as AC6 and LLVM to get Helium auto-vectorization support. Most common compilers including Arm AC6, LLVM, IAR and Gcc now support Helium.
Suitable Products
RA8M1, RA8D1, RA8T1, RA8E1, RA8E2
